channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Street Lights out, 15th July
item.description:
Dear Sir or Madam RE: Failure of Street Lighting Provision in Elgin Avenue, Maida Vale, London W9 I reside at 74 Elgin Avenue, Maida Vale, London W9 2HD. Upon returning home one evening three weeks ago, I noticed that the lampposts nearest to my flat were no longer illuminating our stretch of pavement. For unaccompanied women in particular, walking home in central London at night it is an unsettling experience when street lights malfunction and parts of our route home are plunged into darkness. I can not see what I am treading in! The property becomes more vulnerable too. Please ask your maintenance staff to make the necessary repairs to these lampposts as a matter of urgency? If you need anything further from me, you can reach me by email at sandra@pricesbackclinic.com or via my mobile, 07956 327652. I look forward to hearing from you soon. Sincerely, Sandra Price

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 76, Elgin Avenue, Maida Vale, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Ongoing loud antisocial behaviour and racist verbal abuse at Ridley Villas, Hackney E8., 15th July
item.description:

item.title: Bradbury street, 14th July
item.description:
Absolutely disgusting and vile constantly left outside residents doors from other business been like this for days it happens all the time! We don’t want to live like this please arrange for buisness to dump their rubbish on their own side of the street!

item.title: Concrete Fencing aged and deteriorated, 14th July
item.description:
Concrete Fencing at the back of 154 Elderfield Road/Chatsworth Road Estate has aged and deteriorated over the year's. A few years ago the Council repaired and replaced the concrete fencing at the side and back of 152 Elderfield Road setting a precedent.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Lockhurst Street, Hackney, London

item.title: Illuminated Sign Lights, 14th July
item.description:
Outside Cobans Kitchen restaurant, Arnsberg Way, Bexleyheath: The illuminated lights for a “No U-Turn” sign have been hit by a vehicle meaning the lights are no longer over the sign - asset ID number 13. Please could the sign lights be realigned. Picture attached.
